title.narrative: 1. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: By 2022, technical departments have strengthened capacities to provide improved services for potable water, hygiene and sanitation in rural areas., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, technical departments have strengthened capacities to provide improved services for potable water, hygiene and sanitationin rural areas.

description.narrative: Despite the high negative drilling rate in certain regions, the country office (CO) continues to prospect interventions areas to provide sufficient and quality water to communities. In 2021 the CO constructed 13 water solar ;systems and rehabilitated 35 hand pump drillings, in Centre-Nord, Centre-Ouest and Est regions. This allowed approximatively 68,500 people (33,228 women) to gain access to clean water. Additionally, the CO is implementing the water safety plan (WSP) in Centre-Ouest and Est regions, and supporting the ;development of a code of conduct for drilling constructions, to improve the sustainability of infrastructures ;and ;the quality of household drinking water. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:30/01/2022
